# Performance Food Group Company (PFGC) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Performance Food Group Company (PFGC) is an industry leader and one of the largest food and foodservice distribution companies in North America with more than 150 locations in the U.S. and parts of Canada. Founded and headquartered in Richmond, Virginia, PFG and our family of companies market and deliver quality food and related products to 300,000+ locations including independent and chain restaurants; businesses, schools and healthcare facilities; vending and office coffee service distributors; and big box retailers, theaters and convenience stores.

It is the third-largest food service distributor in the U.S., after Sysco and US Foods. Performance Food Group Company was founded in 1885 and is headquartered in Richmond, Virginia. The company is ranked 80th on the Fortune 500 and 1129th on the Forbes Global 2000.

The company offers beef, pork, poultry, and seafood; frozen food and refrigerated products; dry groceries comprising cleaning and kitchen supplies and disposables; candy, snacks, and beverages; and fresh products, groceries, dairy, bread, beverages, general merchandise, and health and beauty care products, as well as cigarettes and other nicotine products. In addition, the company provides marketing programs and technology solutions to customer locations, as well as value-added services in the areas of product selection and procurement, menu development, and operational strategy. It serves individual restaurants, national and regional chain restaurants, vending distributors, theaters, retailers, and national, regional, and independent convenience stores.

PFG's 30,000+ dedicated associates are committed to building strong relationships with the valued customers, suppliers and communities we serve.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

PFGC operates through three main business segments:

### Foodservice Segment (53% of 2025 revenues)
The Foodservice segment delivers food and food-related products to independent restaurants, chain restaurants, and other institutional food-away-from-home locations.

### Convenience Segment (39% of 2025 revenues)
The Convenience segment consists of a range of products, marketing programs and technology solutions to locations in the United States and Canada.

### Specialty Segment (8% of 2025 revenues)
The Specialty segment offers candy, snack, and beverage to customers in the vending, office coffee services, theater, retail, and other channels.

Based in Richmond, Virginia, PFG offers several turnkey c-store food programs, including Contiga Taqueria, Deli 55, Perfectly Southern, The Red Seal pizzeria and Tru-Q BBQ. PFG has owned and operated Core-Mark since late 2021.

## 9. Market Shares

Sysco Corporation stands as the global leader in foodservice distribution. In 2024, Sysco commanded a substantial 17% market share within the U.S. foodservice distribution sector. For fiscal year 2025, Sysco reported net sales amounting to $81.4 billion.

US Foods is another major competitor, demonstrating robust performance with net sales of $37.9 billion in fiscal year 2024 and continued market share expansion in Q1 2025.

It is the third-largest food service distributor in the U.S., after Sysco and US Foods. While specific market share percentages for PFGC are not disclosed in the recent sources, the company maintains its position as the third-largest player in a highly fragmented industry.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**Main Competitors:**
• Sysco Corporation and US Foods, both significant players with extensive reach and market presence
• The Chefs' Warehouse, US Foods Holding, Core-Mark Holding Company, Mayca Distribuidores, and United Natural Foods are some of the 27 competitors of Performance Food Group

**Competitive Positioning:**
PFGC differentiates itself through its diversified business model serving multiple end markets including vending, convenience stores, and specialized segments that provide some insulation from competitive pressures in traditional broadline foodservice distribution.

The company's geographic footprint and local market expertise in various regions also provide competitive advantages in serving customers with specific regional preferences and requirements. Market consolidation has been a key trend in the industry, with larger players like PFGC, Sysco, and US Foods gaining market share through acquisitions of smaller regional distributors.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent M&A Activity:**
This strategic expansion is bolstered by recent acquisitions, such as José Santiago, Inc. in Puerto Rico in July 2024 and Cheney Brothers.

**Terminated US Foods Merger:**
Performance Food Group Company ("PFG" or the "Company") (NYSE: PFGC) today announced that the Company and US Foods have mutually agreed to terminate the previously announced information sharing process and will no longer pursue a potential business combination between the two companies. "Following a comprehensive evaluation of regulatory considerations and synergies related to a potential business combination with US Foods, with the assistance of our independent financial and legal advisors, we have decided to terminate discussions," said George Holm, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of PFG.

But regulatory concerns were always a major question mark. A decade ago, the federal government blocked a planned Sysco-US Foods merger.

## 12. Recent Developments

**Leadership Succession (January 1, 2026):**
Performance Food Group Company ("PFG" or the "Company") (NYSE: PFGC) today announced that, as part of a planned succession process, George Holm will transition to the role of Executive Chair of the Board of Directors, effective Jan. 1, 2026. Scott McPherson, currently President and Chief Operating Officer (COO) of PFG, will succeed Holm as Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of PFG and will also be appointed as a member of the Company's Board at that time.

McPherson, whose extensive experience includes having served as CEO of CoreMark, became President and COO at PFG in January 2025. He previously served as Chief Field Operations Officer, where he oversaw the Company's primary business segments: Performance Foodservice, Core-Mark, and Vistar since January 2024. Over the course of his more than 30-year career, McPherson has been recognized for his innovative contributions to sales and marketing, his valuable expertise in supply chain management and divisional operations, and for his commitment to cultivating a positive, collaborative company culture.

**Q1 2026 Strong Performance:**
"Our organization began fiscal 2026 with strong results, building upon our momentum and finishing the quarter with solid sales growth and share gains," said George Holm, PFG's Chairman Chief Executive Officer.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Analyst Consensus:**
According to 9 analysts, the average rating for PFGC stock is "Strong Buy." The 12-month stock price target is $116.22, which is an increase of 24.82% from the latest price.

In the current month, PFGC has received 15 Buy Ratings, 7 Hold Ratings, and 0 Sell Ratings. PFGC average Analyst price target in the past 3 months is 119.13.

**Financial Outlook:**
The company raised fiscal 2026 sales guidance and maintains strong EBITDA targets, demonstrating management confidence. The successful integration of acquisitions like Cheney Brothers and consistent market share gains in independent foodservice provide solid growth foundations.

**Investment Strengths:**
• Third-largest market position with defensive characteristics
• Diversified revenue streams across foodservice, convenience, and specialty
• Strong cash generation and disciplined capital allocation
• Experienced new leadership with deep industry knowledge
• Robust M&A pipeline for continued growth

**Investment Concerns:**
• High debt levels and interest coverage concerns
• Exposure to restaurant industry cyclicality
• Margin pressure from cost inflation
• Competitive intensity from larger players

**Buy Rating: 7.2/10**

Given PFGC's solid market position, diversified business model, strong Q1 2026 results, and positive analyst sentiment, the stock merits a "Buy" rating for growth-oriented portfolios with moderate risk tolerance. The leadership transition appears well-planned, and the company's strategic positioning should benefit from continued foodservice industry recovery.

**Fair Value Estimate: $115-120**

Based on analyst consensus targets, the company's three-year growth projections, and current valuation metrics, a fair value range of $115-120 appears reasonable. This represents approximately 30-35% upside potential from current levels around $88, reflecting the company's growth prospects and market leadership position while accounting for near-term execution risks.
